1.name: Casablanca
1.description: A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.

2.name: To Be or Not to Be
2.description: During the Nazi occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

3.name: Now, Voyager
3.description: A frumpy spinster blossoms under therapy and becomes an elegant, independent woman.

4.name: Commandos Strike at Dawn
4.description: A gentle widower, enraged at Nazi atrocities against his peaceful Norwegian fishing village, escapes to Britain and returns leading a commando force against the oppressors.

5.name: Kings Row
5.description: The dark side and hypocrisy of provincial American life is seen through the eyes of five children as they grow to adulthood at the turn-of-the-century.

6.name: George Washington Slept Here
6.description: When Bill and Connie Fuller are forced to move out of their Manhattan apartment because of their pet dog, Connie persuades Bill to buy a dilapidated old Pennsylvania house that George Washington allegedly slept in.

7.name: Bambi
7.description: The story of a young deer growing up in the forest.

8.name: Always in My Heart
8.description: After many years, MacKenzie Scott is pardoned from prison, but his wife is already involved with another man. Nevertheless, he travels incognito to his family's town. There he befriends his...                See full summary »

9.name: Saboteur
9.description: An aircraft factory worker goes on the run after being wrongly accused of starting a fire that killed his best friend.

10.name: Mrs. Miniver
10.description: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

11.name: Cat People
11.description: An American man marries a Serbian immigrant who fears that she will turn into the cat person of her homeland's fables if they are intimate together.

12.name: The Spoilers
12.description: In Nome, Alaska, miner Roy Glennister and his partner Dextry, financed by saloon entertainer Cherry Malotte, fight to save their gold claim from crooked commissioner Alexander McNamara.

13.name: All Through the Night
13.description: Runyonesque Broadway gamblers turn patriotic when they stumble onto a cell of Nazi saboteurs.

14.name: The Magnificent Ambersons
14.description: The spoiled young heir to the decaying Amberson fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

15.name: This Gun for Hire
15.description: When assassin Philip Raven shoots a blackmailer and his beautiful female companion dead, he is paid off in marked bills by his treasonous employer who is working with foreign spies.

16.name: Woman of the Year
16.description: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when Sam comes to resent Tess' hectic lifestyle.

17.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy
17.description: The life of the renowned musical composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

18.name: The Ox-Bow Incident
18.description: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.

19.name: Nazi Agent
19.description: A story of German-born identical twins (both played by Veidt), one a loyal American and the other, a Nazi official.

20.name: Jungle Book
20.description: A boy raised by wolves tries to adapt to human village life.

21.name: Road to Morocco
21.description: Two carefree castaways on a desert shore find an Arabian Nights city, where they compete for the luscious Princess Shalmar.

22.name: Random Harvest
22.description: An amnesiac World War I veteran falls in love with a music hall star, only to suffer an accident which restores his original memories but erases his post-war life.

23.name: Reap the Wild Wind
23.description: Florida ship salvager, Loxi, falls for Jack, captain of a ship wrecked on the Key West shore. However, their romance is complicated by the arrival of another suitor, and eventually leads to tragedy.

24.name: The Major and the Minor
24.description: A woman disguises herself as a child to save on a train fare and is taken in charge by an army man who doesn't notice the truth.

25.name: In Which We Serve
25.description: This "story of a ship", the British destroyer H.M.S. Torrin, is told in flashbacks by survivors as they cling to a life raft.

26.name: Holiday Inn
26.description: At an inn which is only open on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.

27.name: American Empire
27.description: Two men join forces to build a cattle empire, battle rustlers, bad weather and each other.

28.name: The Pride of the Yankees
28.description: The story of the life and career of famed baseball player Lou Gehrig.

29.name: I Married a Witch
29.description: A beautiful 17th-century witch returns to life to plague politician Wallace Wooley, descendant of her persecutor.

30.name: The Talk of the Town
30.description: An escaped prisoner and a stuffy law professor vie for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher.

31.name: The Man Who Came to Dinner
31.description: When acerbic critic Sheridan Whiteside slips on the front steps of a provincial Ohio businessman's home and breaks his hip, he and his entourage take over the house indefinitely.

32.name: One of Our Aircraft Is Missing
32.description: When Nazi anti-aircraft fire damages a British bomber, its crew bails out and seeks help from the Dutch underground.

33.name: In This Our Life
33.description: The day before her wedding, a pampered young woman absconds with her sister's husband; in retaliation, her sister begins seeing the woman's former fiancé.

34.name: Flying Tigers
34.description: Capt. Jim Gordon's command of the famed American mercenary fighter group in China is complicated by the recruitment of an old friend who is a reckless hotshot.

35.name: The Black Swan
35.description: An ex-pirate contends with rowdy buccaneers and a love-hate relationship with an aristocratic woman who's tougher than she seems.

36.name: The Ghost of Frankenstein
36.description: When Ygor brings the Monster to Dr. Ludwig Frankenstein for care, Ludwig gets the idea of replacing the Monster's current criminal brain with a normal one.

37.name: The Palm Beach Story
37.description: An inventor needs cash to develop his big idea. His wife, who loves him, decides to raise it for him by divorcing him and marrying a millionaire.

38.name: Blondie's Blessed Event
38.description: Cynical writer George Wickley arrives as the Bumstead household experiences the birth of daughter Cookie.

39.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
39.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson must protect a Swiss inventor of an advanced bomb sight from falling into German hands.

40.name: A-Haunting We Will Go
40.description: Stan and Ollie get involved with con men, crooks, a genial magician, and two interchangeable coffins with disastrous but funny results.

41.name: The Glass Key
41.description: A crooked politician finds himself being accused of murder by a gangster from whom he refused help during a re-election campaign.

42.name: Went the Day Well?
42.description: An English village is occupied by disguised German paratroopers as an advance post for a planned invasion.

43.name: You Were Never Lovelier
43.description: In Buenos Aires, a man who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age allows an American dancer to perform at his club under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter.

44.name: Tales of Manhattan
44.description: A formal tailcoat that gets passed from one owner to another affects each life in a significant way.

45.name: The First of the Few
45.description: Aircraft designer/patriot R. J. Mitchell, alarmed at growing German militarism, works to perfect a defense against the German Messerschmidt at the cost of his health.

46.name: Across the Pacific
46.description: In December 1941, ex-army captain Rick Leland boards a Japanese ship heading to Asia via the Panama Canal where his Japanese hosts show interest in the American defense plans for the canal zone.

47.name: Who Done It?
47.description: Two dumb soda jerks dream of writing radio mysteries. When they try to pitch an idea at a radio station, they end up in the middle of a real murder when the station owner is killed during a broadcast.

48.name: Arabian Nights
48.description: The caliph of Baghdad must go into hiding with a group of traveling performers when his brother usurps the throne. Both brothers desire a beautiful dancing girl, who is torn between power and true love.

49.name: For Me and My Gal
49.description: Two vaudeville performers fall in love, but find their relationship tested by the arrival of WWI.

50.name: Wake Island
50.description: December, 1941. With no hope of relief or re-supply, a small band of United States Marines tries to keep the Japanese Navy from capturing their island base.
